title: UK stocks ease as market awaits Brexit deal update
text:
Traders looks at financial information on computer screens on the IG Index trading floor in London, Britain February 6, 2018. REUTERS/Simon Dawson/Files

(Reuters) - London’s domestically-focussed mid-cap index shed almost half of the previous session’s more than 1% gain in early trade on Wednesday, with investors awaiting confirmation that a Brexit deal is really in the offing.

The FTSE 250 .FTMC, which has rallied more than 3% since last week on hopes that Britain could clinch a timely divorce deal, shed 0.5%, with traders eyeing a crunch summit this week after last-ditch talks between London and the European Union.

The blue-chip FTSE 100 .FTSE was also marginally lower, with miner Rio Tinto (RIO.L) and housebuilder Barratt (BDEV.L) slipping respectively 2% and 2.7% on signs of weakening future revenue.
description: London's domestically-focussed mid-cap index shed almost half of the previous session's more than 1% gain in early trade on Wednesday, with investors awaiting confirmation that a Brexit deal is really in the offing.
